args: All right! Today, I'm gonna tell you kids the\nstory of my journey to the Shifting Isle!
Looks like the little ones are all gathered\ntogether. Did somethin' happen?
Pietro is just telling them a story.
Pietro? Y'mean the feller what's always\ngoin' on about that ＂frozen city＂ nonsense?
One and the same. Today he's telling them\na story about the ＂Shifting Isle.＂ Honestly,\nthey seem rather delighted about it.
Hmph! I reckon it'll be trouble if those\nyoung'uns start believin' a buncha\nhorse plop like that.
Come now. I'm sure the children are\nenjoying themselves BECAUSE they\nknow his tales are impossible.
...And at that moment, the island rumbled,\nshook, and began to move!
Because what we had believed to be an\nisland was in fact...a giant TURTLE!
No waaay! There's no such thing as\ngiant turtles!
And yet there it was, big as can be!
So what happened to the turtle after that?

He disappeared into the depths of the sea.
And had I not jumped on board the ship,
I'd also have been swallowed up by the
deep, dark waves!
Well, that's all for today, kids.
Well, it seems that people around here\nthink you might be stretching the truth\na bit when it comes to your stories.
Aw, is that all? Heh, can't really blame\n'em for not believing the sorta stories\nI've been tellin'.
Er, but aren't all of your stories true?
Of course! Every single one is a true story\nbased on something I experienced.
And it doesn't upset you that no one\nactually believes you?
I take it you two know each other?
Sure do. I owe my life to Pietro here!
Aw, it's nothing so special as all that.
Ha! If he hadn't been around, I'd be\nresting in a watery grave, make no\nmistake.
Still can't believe that island was actually\na turtle...
Huh? Wait, so that story he was just\ntelling the kids was—
Yep! It's as true as the day is long.\nMan, those were some crazy times.
That's what I said.\nWhat, you didn't believe me?
It's not about me; it's about the others.
If you have this man tell them what he\nsaid just now, I bet they'll change their\nminds about you!
Oh, you don't need to do that.
But this is your chance to prove that you're\nmore than just some wild tale-spinner.

Honestly? I don't really care what those
folks think of me. Besides, having my pal
here come in would ruin the story for all
those little kids.
Well, if they know for sure if a certain\ntale is true or not, then...
Then none of them will ever venture\nout to see if it's true for themselves!
Of course! Hearts burning with desire to\nknow the truth or falsity of a tale is what\nsets people off on adventure!

That's fun, if you ask me—and I want the
kids to know what it feels like. So that's
why I don't care if the adults think I'm a
liar or not.
...Oops! Sorry, but I gotta go.\nI think I hear company coming.
